criteria: Understanding of Explorers' Motivations and Impact
descriptions: The student does not attempt to trace any routes or the attempt is entirely inaccurate.
The student attempts to trace routes, but demonstrates significant inaccuracies and omissions.
The student traces some routes with moderate accuracy, but several inaccuracies or omissions are present.
The student accurately traces most of the major routes, with only minor inaccuracies or omissions.
The student traces the routes of early explorers with a high degree of accuracy and includes almost all significant routes.
The student meticulously traces the routes of early explorers with complete accuracy and includes all significant routes, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
The student provides no description of early explorations or the description is irrelevant.
The student attempts to describe early explorations, but the description is very brief and lacks detail.
The student provides a basic description of some early explorations, but it is incomplete and lacks depth.
The student describes several early explorations with reasonable detail, but some important explorations are missing.
The student comprehensively describes the early explorations of the Americas, including most major expeditions and their impact.
The student provides an exceptionally detailed and comprehensive description of early explorations, including lesser-known expeditions, and analyzes their lasting impact on the Americas.
The student shows no understanding of the explorers' motivations or the impact of their explorations.
The student demonstrates a minimal understanding of the explorers' motivations or impact.
The student identifies some motivations or impacts, but the explanation is superficial.
The student explains the explorers' motivations and the impact of their explorations with some clarity and provides supporting details.
The student clearly explains the explorers' motivations and the impact of their explorations, providing relevant supporting details and demonstrating a solid understanding of the historical context.

The student provides a nuanced and insightful analysis of the explorers' motivations and the complex impact of their explorations, demonstrating a deep understanding of the historical context and its long-term consequences.
